metadata.title: CVE-2019-19058 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A memory leak in the alloc_sgtable() function indrivers/net/wireless/intel/iwlwifi/fw/dbg.c in the Linux kernel through5.3.11 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption)by triggering alloc_page() failures, aka CID-b4b814fec1a5.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19058` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-e500mc - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-emb - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-91-generic - 4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-91-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-91-lowlatency - 4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-91-generic - 4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-91-lowlatency - 4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1063-aws - 4.15.0-1063.67~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1075-azure - 4.15.0-1075.80
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1058-gcp - 4.15.0-1058.62
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1035-oracle - 4.15.0-1035.38~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.2.0-1013-raspi2 - 4.2.0-1013.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-16.19').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1063.67~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1075.80').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1058.62').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1035.38~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-1013.19').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1012.12').
